00024 /*! internal: no dup hash_table log save */
00025 static HASH_TABLE *_n_nodup_table = NULL ;
00026 
00027 /*!\fn init_nodup_log( int max )
00028  *\brief initialize the no duplicate logging system
00029  *\param max the max size of the internal hash table. Leave it to zero or
00030  negative to keep the internal value in use ( 1024 )
00031  *\return TRUE or FALSE */
00032 int init_nodup_log( int max )
00033 {
00034                 if( _n_nodup_table != NULL )
00035                 {
00036                                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Could not allocate the internal hash table because it's already done" );
00037                                 return FALSE ;
00038                 }
00039                 if( max <= 0 )
00040                                 max = 1024 ;
00041 
00042                 _n_nodup_table = new_ht( max );
00043 
00044                 if( _n_nodup_table == NULL )
00045                 {
00046                                 n_log( LOG_ERR , "Could not allocate the internal hash with size %d" , max );
00047                                 return FALSE ;
00048                 }
00049                 else
00050                 {
00051                                 n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "LOGGING: nodup system activated with a hash table of %d cells" , max );
00052                 }
00053 
00054                 return TRUE ;
00055 } /* init_nodup_log() */
00056 
00057 
00058 
00059 /*!\fn int empty_nodup_table()
00060  * \brief Empty the nodup internal table 
00061  * \return TRUE or FALSE 
00062  */
00063 int empty_nodup_table()
00064 {
00065                 __n_assert( _n_nodup_table , return FALSE );
00066                 return empty_ht( _n_nodup_table ); 
00067 } /* empty_nodup_table() */
00068 
00069 
00070 
00071 /*!\fn int close_nodup_log()
00072  * \brief Empty nodup logtable and close the no duplicate logging session  
00073  * \return TRUE or FALSE 
00074  */
00075 int close_nodup_log()
00076 {
00077                 __n_assert( _n_nodup_table , return FALSE );
00078                 return destroy_ht( &_n_nodup_table ); 
00079 } /* close_nodup_log() */

00082 /*!\fn char *get_nodup_key( const char *file , const char *func , int line )
00083  *\brief internal, get a key for a log entry
00084  *\param file log source file
00085  *\param func log source
00086  *\param line log source
00087  *\return The key for the the log entry
00088  */
00089 static char *get_nodup_key( const char *file , const char *func , int line )
00090 {
00091                 N_STR *nstr = NULL ;
00092                 char *ptr = NULL ;
00093                 nstrprintf( nstr , "%s%s%d" , file , func , line );
00094                 __n_assert( nstr , return NULL );
00095                 ptr = nstr -> data ;
00096                 Free( nstr );
00097                 return ptr ;
00098 } /* get_nodup_key */
00099 
00100 
00101 
00102 /*!\fn char *get_nodup_indexed_key( const char *file , const char *func , const char *prefix , int line )
00103  *\brief internal, get a key for an indexed log entry 
00104  *\param file log source file
00105  *\param func log source
00106  *\param line log source
00107  *\param prefix prefix for log entry
00108  *\return The key for the the log entry
00109  */
00110 static char *get_nodup_indexed_key( const char *file , const char *func , const char *prefix , int line )
00111 {
00112                 N_STR *nstr = NULL ;
00113                 char *ptr = NULL ;
00114                 nstrprintf( nstr , "%s%s%s%d" , file , func , prefix , line );
00115                 __n_assert( nstr , return NULL );
00116                 ptr = nstr -> data ;
00117                 Free( nstr );
00118                 return ptr ;
00119 } /* get_nodup_key */

00124 /*!\fn check_n_log_dup( const char *log , const char *file , const char *func , int line )
00125  * \brief check if a log was already done or not at the given line, func, file
00126  * \param log the line of log
00127  * \param file the file containing the log
00128  * \param func the name of calling func
00129  * \param line the line of the log
00130  * \return 0 if not existing 1 if existing with the same value , 2 if key exist
00131  and value is different 
00132  */
00133 int check_n_log_dup( const char *log , const char *file , const char *func , int line )
00134 {
00135                 HASH_NODE *node = NULL ;
00136                 char *key = NULL ;
00137 
00138                 /* check if the nopdup session is on, else do a normal n_log */
00139                 if( !_n_nodup_table )
00140                 {
00141                                 return 3 ; 
00142                 }
00143 
00144 
00145                 key = get_nodup_key( file  , func , line );
00146 
00147                 __n_assert( key , return FALSE );
00148 
00149                 node = ht_get_node( _n_nodup_table , key );
00150 
00151                 if( node )
00152                 {
00153                                 if( strcmp( log , node -> data . string ) == 0 )
00154                                 {
00155                                                 return 1 ; 
00156                                 }
00157                                 return 2 ;
00158                 }
00159                 return 0 ;
00160 
00161 } /* check_n_log_dup(...) */
00162 
00163 
00164 /*!\fn check_n_log_dup_indexed( const char *log , const char *file , const char *func , int line , const char *prefix )
00165  * \brief check if a log was already done or not at the given line, func, file
00166  * \param log the line of log
00167  * \param file the file containing the log
00168  * \param func the name of calling func
00169  * \param line the line of the log
00170  * \param prefix prefix to subgroup logs
00171  * \return 0 if not existing 1 if existing with the same value , 2 if key exist
00172  and value is different 
00173  */
00174 int check_n_log_dup_indexed( const char *log , const char *file , const char *func , int line , const char *prefix )
00175 {
00176                 HASH_NODE *node = NULL ;
00177                 char *key = NULL ;
00178 
00179                 /* check if the nopdup session is on, else do a normal n_log */
00180                 if( !_n_nodup_table )
00181                 {
00182                                 return 3 ; 
00183                 }
00184 
00185                 key = get_nodup_indexed_key( file  , func , prefix , line );
00186 
00187                 __n_assert( key , return FALSE );
00188 
00189                 node = ht_get_node( _n_nodup_table , key );
00190 
00191                 if( node )
00192                 {
00193                                 if( strcmp( log , node -> data . string ) == 0 )
00194                                 {
00195                                                 return 1 ; 
00196                                 }
00197                                 return 2 ;
00198                 }
00199                 return 0 ;
00200 } /* check_nolog_dup_indexed() */

00204 /*!\fn void _n_nodup_log( int LEVEL , const char *file , const char *func , int line , const char *format , ... )
00205  *\brief Logging function. log( level , const char *format , ... ) is a macro around _log
00206  *\param LEVEL Logging level 
00207  *\param file File containing the emmited log
00208  *\param func Function emmiting the log
00209  *\param line Line of the log
00210  *\param format Format and string of the log, printf style
00211  */
00212 void _n_nodup_log( int LEVEL , const char *file , const char *func , int line , const char *format , ... )
00213 {
00214                 HASH_NODE *node = NULL ;
00215                 va_list args ;
00216 
00217                 char *syslogbuffer = NULL ;
00218 
00219                 va_start (args, format);
00220                 vasprintf( &syslogbuffer , format , args ); 
00221                 va_end( args );
00222 
00223                 char *key = get_nodup_key( file , func , line );
00224                 int is_dup = check_n_log_dup( syslogbuffer , file , func , line );
00225 
00226                 switch( is_dup )
00227                 {
00228                                 /* new log entry for file,func,line */
00229                                 case 0 :
00230                                                 if( _n_nodup_table )
00231                                                 {
00232                                                                 ht_put_string( _n_nodup_table , key , syslogbuffer );
00233                                                 }
00234                                                 _n_log( LEVEL , file , func , line , "%s" , syslogbuffer );
00235                                                 break ;
00236 
00237                                                 /* exising and same log entry, do nothing (maybe latter we will add a timeout to repeat logging)  */
00238                                 case 1 :
00239                                                 break ; 
00240                                                 /* existing but different entry. We have to refresh and log it one time*/
00241                                 case 2 :
00242                                                 node = ht_get_node( _n_nodup_table , key );
00243                                                 if( node && node -> data . string )
00244                                                 {
00245                                                                 Free( node -> data . string );
00246                                                                 node -> data . string = syslogbuffer ;
00247                                                 }
00248                                                 _n_log( LEVEL , file , func , line , "%s" , syslogbuffer );
00249                                                 break ;
00250                                                 /* no nodup session started, normal loggin */
00251                                 case 3 :
00252                                                 _n_log( LEVEL , file , func , line , "%s" , syslogbuffer );
00253                                                 break ;
00254                 }
00255 
00256                 Free( syslogbuffer );
00257                 Free( key );
00258 
00259 } /* _n_nodup_log() */
00260 
00261 
00262 /*!\fn void _n_nodup_log_indexed( int LEVEL , const char *prefix , const char *file , const char *func , int line , const char *format , ... )
00263  *\brief Logging function. log( level , const char *format , ... ) is a macro around _log
00264  *\param LEVEL Logging level 
00265  *\param prefix prefix to subgroup logs
00266  *\param file File containing the emmited log
00267  *\param func Function emmiting the log
00268  *\param line Line of the log
00269  *\param format Format and string of the log, printf style
00270  */
00271 void _n_nodup_log_indexed( int LEVEL , const char *prefix , const char *file , const char *func , int line , const char *format , ... )
00272 {
00273                 HASH_NODE *node = NULL ;
00274                 va_list args ;
00275 
00276                 char *syslogbuffer = NULL ;
00277 
00278                 va_start (args, format);
00279                 vasprintf( &syslogbuffer , format , args ); 
00280                 va_end( args );
00281 
00282                 char *key = get_nodup_indexed_key( file , func , prefix , line );
00283                 int is_dup = check_n_log_dup_indexed( syslogbuffer , file , func , line , prefix );
00284 
00285                 switch( is_dup )
00286                 {
00287                                 /* new log entry for file,func,line */
00288                                 case 0 :
00289                                                 if( _n_nodup_table )
00290                                                 {
00291                                                                 ht_put_string( _n_nodup_table , key , syslogbuffer );
00292                                                 }
00293                                                 _n_log( LEVEL , file , func , line , "%s" , syslogbuffer );
00294                                                 break ;
00295 
00296                                                 /* exising and same log entry, do nothing (maybe latter we will add a timeout to repeat logging)  */
00297                                 case 1 :
00298                                                 break ; 
00299                                                 /* existing but different entry. We have to refresh and log it one time*/
00300                                 case 2 :
00301                                                 node = ht_get_node( _n_nodup_table , key );
00302                                                 if( node && node -> data . string )
00303                                                 {
00304                                                                 Free( node -> data . string );
00305                                                                 node -> data . string = syslogbuffer ;
00306                                                 }
00307                                                 _n_log( LEVEL , file , func , line , "%s" , syslogbuffer );
00308                                                 break ;
00309                                                 /* no nodup session started, normal loggin */
00310                                 case 3 :
00311                                                 _n_log( LEVEL , file , func , line , "%s" , syslogbuffer );
00312                                                 break ;
00313 
00314                 }
00315 
00316                 Free( syslogbuffer );
00317                 Free( key );
00318 
00319 } /* _n_nodup_log_indexed() */

00323 /*!\fn void dump_nodup_log( char *file )
00324  *\brief Dump the duplicate error log hash table in a file 
00325  *\param file The path and filename to the dump file
00326  *\return TRUE or FALSE
00327  */
00328 int dump_nodup_log( char *file )
00329 {
00330                 FILE *out = NULL ;
00331                 HASH_NODE *hash_node = NULL ;
00332                 __n_assert( file , return FALSE );
00333                 __n_assert( _n_nodup_table , return FALSE );
00334 
00335                 char *tmpfile = NULL ;
00336                 n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "outfile:%s" , file );
00337                 strprintf( tmpfile , "%s.tmp" , file );
00338 
00339                 out = fopen( tmpfile , "wb" );
00340                 __n_assert( out , return FALSE );
00341 
00342                 if( _n_nodup_table )
00343                 {
00344                                 for( int it = 0 ; it < _n_nodup_table -> size ; it ++ )
00345                                 {
00346                                                 list_foreach( list_node , _n_nodup_table -> hash_table[ it ] )
00347                                                 {
00348                                                                 hash_node = (HASH_NODE *)list_node -> ptr ;
00349                                                                 fprintf( out , "%s\n" , hash_node -> data . string );
00350                                                 }
00351                                 }
00352                 }
00353                 fclose( out );
00354 
00355                 char *cmd = NULL ;
00356                 strprintf( cmd , "mv -f %s %s ; chmod 644 %s" , tmpfile , file , file );
00357                 n_log( LOG_DEBUG , "%s" , cmd );
00358                 system( cmd );
00359 
00360                 Free( cmd );
00361                 Free( tmpfile );
00362 
00363                 return TRUE ;
00364 
00365 } /* dump_nodup_log() */
